title: Ably Connections Client Event
description: A message sent on the clientEvents:connections metachannel describing a sampled client connection.

host.description: The HTTP Host header of the connection request.

requestId.description: The unique ID of the connection request that Ably can use to correlate a connection event with internal logs, if necessary.

site.description: The site the connection was established to.

headers.description: The HTTP headers of the connection request. Header names are lower case (e.g. 'accept', 'content-type', 'user-agent', etc.).

ably-agent.description: The Ably-Agent header describing the SDK and runtime environment of the client.

x-ably-version.description: The Ably API protocol version expected by the client.

x-geoip.description: Geographic information related to the detected IP address of the client formatted as '<country-code>,<region>,<latitude>,<longitude>'

x-request-start.description: The time the request was received by Ably's routing layer, represented as the number of milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC

query.description: The parsed query component of the connection request, excluding authentication parameters. The query contains connection information such as the client library version and any custom transport parameters.

agent.description: The Ably-Agent header describing the SDK and runtime environment of the client.

format.description: The format used to encode protocol messages. Either 'json' or 'msgpack'.

heartbeats.description: The type of heartbeats to send on the connection. True for Ably protocol heartbeats, false for transport specific heartbeats.

v.description: The Ably API protocol version expected by the client.

connectionId.description: The unique ID of the connection.

clientId.description: The ID of the client that attempted the connection.

channels.description: The list of channels referenced in the connection request. This is only relevant where channels are supported as part of the connection request, such as with SSE.

duration.description: The duration the connection was open for in milliseconds.

credential.description: Details of the credential used to authenticate the client.

hasUserClaims.description: Does this token contain user claims.

hasLimitsClaims.description: Does this token contain limits claims.

error.description: The details of any error encountered whilst processing the connection.
